time.quote: Time does not discriminate. It does not care if we are happy or sad. It does not slow or hurry. It’s a linear creature, traveling in one direction, constant even through pain.
time.author: Ana Johns

time.quote: Life is too short for unreality and you don’t owe anybody anything - especially your time, energy, and attention.
time.author: Oli Anderson

time.quote: Fate is coming. That I know.Time is running. Got to go.
time.author: AliaZalea

time.quote: It’s lost time that matters, the time between time, the moments when you forget time and things just happen.
time.author: Clifford Thurlow

time.quote: Stories are timeless. They spill through ages, times, genders, races, religions, nationalities. They unite us. With the world the way it is at the moment, they’re one of the only things we’ve got left that does. People are still reading books that were written hundreds of years ago. Children are still brought up with fairy tales that date back to centuries we can’t even imagine living in. That’s magic of a different kind.
time.author: Jaimie Admans

time.quote: Adaptasi, jalani, syukuri, santai, bahagia sampai mati.
time.author: Natanael Jansudin Siregar

time.quote: Spending time near the focal point of a large radio telescope may produce radiation sickness in the human.
time.author: Steven Magee

time.quote: Alice sighed wearily. "I think you might do something better with the time," she said, "then waste it asking riddles that have no answers."If you knew time as well as I do," said the Hatter, "you wouldn't talk about wasting it.
time.author: Lewis Carroll

time.quote: Fear is the movement of time
time.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

time.quote: Thought is the movement of time
time.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

time.quote: Um ein Programm jedoch optimal einsetzen zu können, ist die Kenntnis seiner Leistungsfähigkeit nötig und auch die Routine im Umgang. Das bedeutet in der Praxis, daß man Stunden am Computer verbringt, die vielleicht besser draußen in der Natur mit dem Camcorder genutzt wären.
time.author: Walter Schild

time.quote: None of the day is long enough to complete/achieve the work; we deliberately avoid undertaking or finishing. Start on time to accomplish on time.
time.author: Shahenshah Hafeez Khan

time.quote: It happened forty years ago. It hurts me in some ways more now than it did then, now that I know what a thing like that can mean to a life beyond what it does when it’s happening.
time.author: Allison Moorer

time.quote: ...The best times of my life, the times that passed by me the most quickly, were the times when the roses grew wild.
time.author: Lisa Wingate

time.quote: Wisdom tells us that the most finite resource we have is time. Experience tells us that it is also by far one of the most mismanaged resource.
time.author: Alok Karkera

time.quote: Such is the villainy of the universe’s trickery – Moments commit mistakes and decades endure the misery
time.author: Adeel Ahmed Khan

time.quote: Time passes... but memories do not.
time.author: Lisa Wingate

time.quote: Time is a train of opportunity, empty wagons in the space of existence; our existence is actually the effort of putting materials, values into these empty wagons, spaces of time
time.author: Onakpoberuo Onoriode Victor

time.quote: Follow your own clock and be patient with yourself; but if somehow your clock stopped working, you should be courageous enough to restart it
time.author: Onakpoberuo Onoriode Victor

time.quote: There are tons of things I could and probably should be doing for work right now. But at some point, you have to put it aside and get busy with the things that really matter.
time.author: Lisa Wingate

time.quote: There are lots of places and time, it is better to choose silence if people didn’t want to listen to the truths.
time.author: Kamaran Ihsan Salih

time.quote: Life is short and the opposite of life is bullshit.
time.author: Oli Anderson

time.quote: Time passed. Warehouses shed exoskeletons and became artist lofts. Collapsing Victorians and colonials slouched into their roles as homeless shelters. The suburbs hunched into Squatter City. Malleus Industries International relocated its North American East offices to Oceanrest. Highrises sprouted overnight, a newborn downtown squealing in glass and neon. Oceanrest shivered out from its old skin. Everything became something else, eventually.
time.author: S.R.  Hughes

time.quote: No single week seemed so different from any other week, and yet the years did.
time.author: S.R.  Hughes

time.quote: I'm not a fan of time a lot of the time...wow, maybe I should appreciate it more. It made this sentence possible.
time.author: Aaron Kyle Andresen

time.quote: It feels like someone tore away the other half of the book that I was reading. Probably, I might never get that other half again. I might spend my whole life trying to comprehend how this story would end. But while I hold this half, and read it, I end up seeing a different ending every time. While some of these are worse, and some are beautiful, they all manage to leave a void, which I'll never be able to explain with my mere words. Which makes me wish for that other half of the book even more.
time.author: Akshay Vasu

time.quote: Time is what determines security. With enough time nothing is unhackable.
time.author: Aniekee Tochukwu Ezekiel

time.quote: How the clock moves on, relentlessly,with such assurance that it eats the years.The days are small and transitory grapes,The months grow faded, taken out of time.It fades, it falls away, the moment, firedby that implacable artilleryand suddenly, only a year is left to us,a month, a day, and death turns up in the diary.
time.author: Pablo Neruda

time.quote: Spinning a dance of time.
time.author: Jazz Feylynn

time.quote: Remember your customers appreciate efficiency and convenience and those two become achievable through innovation and willingness to change with time.
time.author: Pooja Agnihotri

time.quote: You only get life once, so use the time
time.author: limon gazi

time.quote: A minute is too long to wait for anything.
time.author: Marty Rubin

time.quote: The past was once the present and the future will once be the present.
time.author: Shubham Sanap

time.quote: The days that pass, which turn into the time that passes, are neither lovely nor hideous, but always the same. Perhaps it rains for a few seconds sometimes, or the four-o'clock sun holds time back for a few minutes like rearing horses. Perhaps the past doesn't always preserve the beautiful order that clocks give to the present, and perhaps the future is rushing up in disorder, each moment tripping over itself, to be the first to slice itself up. And perhaps there is a charm or horror, grace or abjection, in the convulsive movements of what is going to be and of what has been. But Valentin had never taken any pleasure in these suppositions. He still didn't know enough about the subject. He wanted to be content with an identity nicely chopped into pieces of varying lengths, but whose character was always similar, without dyeing it in autumnal colours, drenching it in April showers or mottling it with the instability of clouds.
time.author: Raymond Queneau

time.quote: Impatience is like an urge to experience
time.author: Radapar

time.quote: "I still can't manage to watch the big hand for more than four minutes," said Valentin, indicating Poucier's clock with a look.   The other, following the movement of Valentin's eyes, remained open-mouthed; but he turned smartly back to Valentin when the latter continued:   "After that time, either it's as if I was falling asleep, I don't know what I'm thinking any more and time passes and escapes my control, or else I'm invaded by images, my attention wanders, and it comes to the same thing; time has run out without my feeling it melt away through my fingers."   Jean-Lockwit nodded understandingly.   "Pra, pra, pra, pra," said he, "pra, pra, pra, pra, pra, pra, pra, pra, pra."   Dreaming, he repeated this phrase once again.    "I watch time," said Valentin, "but sometimes I kill it. That isn't what I want."   The other raised his arms into the air, and let them fall again with lassitude and compassion.
time.author: Raymond Queneau

time.quote: Time--an unreliable, fractious creature since the asylum--now absented itself entirely from the proceedings. It left the two of us floating, weightless, like a pair of dust motes suspended in afternoon sunlight.
time.author: Alix E. Harrow

time.quote: Time is not only the best teacher, but it is also a great and remarkable healer that costs nothing, and even that does not need any place for the practice. It is within you.
time.author: Ehsan Sehgal

time.quote: Just like a seed doesn’t turn into a tree the next day after sowing it. In a similar fashion, your idea takes time as well.
time.author: Pooja Agnihotri

time.quote: If people have tasted the convenience, ease, and time-saving effects of a product, they won’t go back.
time.author: Pooja Agnihotri

time.quote: For the growth of a business, we have to evolve whenever the time, environment and people around us change.
time.author: Pooja Agnihotri

time.quote: Some people are too busy to find ways to save time.
time.author: Frank Sonnenberg

time.quote: Most of the time, you’ll concentrate just on your website but when you take your focus off of it, you’ll realize that there’s more to a business than that.
time.author: Pooja Agnihotri

time.quote: It was that hour that turns seafarers' longings homeward- the hour that makes their hearts grow tender upon the day they big sweet friends farewell...
time.author: Dante Alighieri

time.quote: Give your parents more time, then your son and daughter will do the same to you
time.author: limon gazi

time.quote: Saying the time hasn’t arrived doesn’t always work. Everything depends on your determination. If it’s good for you, do it right away. Keep in mind that, time won’t determine success, but your efforts, does.
time.author: SoulWanderer_

time.quote: Time is a whip for the broken face. (Le temps est un fouet Au visage défait)
time.author: Charles de Leusse

time.quote: NEGOTIATE ONLY WHILE SELLING YOUR TIME. MAKING CALCULATIONS ALWAYS IS NOT GOODहिसाब सिर्फ अपना वक़्त बेचते वक़्त कीजियेहर वक़्त हिसाब करना अच्छा नहीं होता
time.author: Vineet Raj Kapoor

time.quote: Even though change is an important part of growth, we still face a hard time liking it. We try to resist it for as long as we can before giving up. Not just in our personal lives, but even in our professional lives
time.author: Pooja Agnihotri

time.quote: good time management requires shift in focus from activities to results, being busy isn't the same as being effective, ironically the opposite is always closer to the truth
time.author: Anath Lee Wales

time.quote: If you spend your time hoping someone will suffer the consequences for what they did to your heart, you would begin to unravel in your mindReestablished Kingdom - The Journal
time.author: Lady Alexis  Essuman

time.quote: If you spend your time hoping someone will suffer the consequences for what they did to your heart, you would begin to unravel in your mind
time.author: Lady Alexis Essuman

time.quote: Life is all a green old English garden and time an endless summer afternoon.
time.author: Henry James

time.quote: The memories made along the way someday arise to defeat the time and become timeless......
time.author: Jayita Bhattacharjee

time.quote: For a while is a phrase whose length can’t be measured. At least by the person who’s waiting," I said (...)And probably is a word whose weight is incalculable.
time.author: Haruki Murakami

time.quote: Sometimes when I look at you, I feel I’m gazing at a distant star," I said. "It’s dazzling, but the light is from tens of thousands of years ago. Maybe the star doesn’t even exist anymore. Yet sometimes that light seems more real to me than anything."Shimamoto said nothing."You’re here," I continued. "At least you look as if you’re here. But maybe you aren’t. Maybe it’s just your shadow. The real you may be someplace else. Or maybe you already disappeared, a long, long time ago. I reach out my hand to see, but you’ve hidden yourself behind a cloud of probablys. Do you think we can go on like this forever?"Possibly. For the time being," she answered."I see I’m not the only one with a strange sense of humor," I said. And smiled.She smiled too. The rain has stopped, without a sound there’s a break in the clouds, and the very first rays of sunlight shine through—that kind of smile. Small, warm lines at the corners of her eyes, holding out the promise of something wonderful.
time.author: Haruki Murakami

time.quote: We are all doing time!
time.author: Honeya

time.quote: Uncertainty is what we know as TIME. Time is controlled in direct ratio to your certainty.
time.author: Meir Ezra

time.quote: I wanted to change my fate, to force it down another road. I wanted to stand in the river of time and make it flow a different direction, if just for a little while.
time.author: April Genevieve Tucholke

time.quote: When time doesn't heal things in life, there's only one way out⁠—seeking help from the one whom all clocks tick for.
time.author: VKBoy

time.quote: Nothing is integral part of something. There’s no such thing as an independent "Nothing" or Nothingness. That is, "Nothing is a state of matter" (or/and) a clear-cut dimension of time. Moreover, Nothing or Nothingness may be the ultimate building block of the universe or time itself. In my view, an ultimate extreme level of a moment in time is nothing but "Nothing" in itself.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: You are each born with the conscious knowledge of what has come before. Your brain is far from an empty slate, waiting for the first imprint of experience; it is already equipped with complete "equations", telling you who you are and where you have come from. Nor do you wipe that slate clean, symbolically speaking, before you write your life upon it. Instead, you draw upon what has gone before: the experiences of your ancestors, back through time immemorial.
time.author: Jane Roberts

time.quote: And within some amount of time that I can't be sure of because I still didn't really understand time and none of the clocks worked anymore, I got an answer.
time.author: Kira Jane Buxton

time.quote: The future of particle physics is not more particles instead moments in time.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: Now is our time to enliven, ennoble and unfold the auspicious flair of our youth.
time.author: Joseph Jacson K.

time.quote: If you feel the distance between you and your loved one is increasing, maybe it’s time for you to stop moving.
time.author: Nitya Prakash

time.quote: Every palace and every work of art is only dust as yet unrealized, and time is the patient wind that will whither it all away.
time.author: Dean Koontz

time.quote: Back when I was young, I had energy but didn’t have the time to spare. Now that I’m old, I have time but don’t have the energy to spare.
time.author: VKBoy Shambala Sect

time.quote: ‪"We don’t pay enough attention to our kids. It’s all about money, chasing the dreams, but our kids are the dreams
time.author: Began Cekic‬

time.quote: Language is the bridge connecting the past, the present and the future.
time.author: Hung.K

time.quote: Time to duct tape shattered dreams back together, they need a shade of grey.
time.author: Nitya Prakash

time.quote: The time is always right to do the right thing.
time.author: Mango Wodzak

time.quote: Once upon a time, people completed each other.Phones do that to us nowadays.
time.author: Nitya Prakash

time.quote: That is what I believed: that time nibbles away at the future, and in that moment puts the present behind its back. The past retreats as each present moment joins it, on and on. Yet that is far too simple. Inside us, time sways backwards and forwards from now to then, here to there, and nothing of it is lost or goes away, but it all hangs everywhere, translucent in the air. Some men turn away, and walk on, saying that the past contains only their former selves and ghosts of people and deeds. Others, like myself, live every day with it.
time.author: Stella Tillyard

time.quote: Death is not the end of your time.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: You aren't a bad decision-maker. You just take time, really long time because you feel you deserve a lot more than what life offers you.
time.author: Nitya Prakash

time.quote: Time never wait for your arguments
time.author: Md Parvej Ansari

time.quote: The time management is in your control, if you will manage it properly, it can create enormous opportunities.
time.author: Fahim Khan

time.quote: Doing our most with time prevents us from being time constrained when there'll no time to check time.
time.author: Vincent Okay Nwachukwu

time.quote: There comes a time when you must no longer step and fetch it and must begin to pitch and catch it.
time.author: Jeffrey Duarte

time.quote: Mastery over misery is no mystery. Time helps but much depends on what one does with time.
time.author: Vincent Okay Nwachukwu

time.quote: Give me the password of time, and I will construct the universe.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: Time is an echo of God.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: Nothing becomes time.Time becomes the Universe.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: The most fundamental building blocks of the basic building blocks of the universe are infinitely divisible moments in time.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: The time in which we live has unfathomable depths beneath it. Our age is a mere film on the surface of time.
time.author: Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn

time.quote: Everything is time. Everything!
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: This is what I've found about life, as I've gotten older: you start to lose people, Angela. It's not that there is ever a shortage of people - oh, heavens no. It is merely that - as the years pass - there comes to be a shortage of your people. The ones you loved. The ones who knew the people that you both loved. The ones who know your whole history. Those people start to be plucked away by death, and they are awfully hard to replace after they go.
time.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

time.quote: But that's the problem with the present, it's never the thing you're holding, only the thing you're watching, later, from a distance so great the memory might as well be a spill of stars outside a window at twilight.
time.author: Kawai Strong Washburn

time.quote: But we don't get to choose when we leave here to sleep on the mountain. We all have to sleep on the mountain one day. Even the bear. Even when we struggle with all our will not to.
time.author: Andrew Krivak

time.quote: It has been an ‘Entertaining’ 4 years with President Trump and it is now time for the finale.
time.author: Steven Magee

time.quote: An unphilosophical but nonetheless effective help to putting death in its place is to run over the list of those who have clung long to life. What did they gain over the untimely dead?In truth, the distance we have to travel is small: and we drag it out with such labor, in such poor company, in such a feeble body. No great thing, then. Look behind you at the huge gulf of time, and another infinity ahead. In this perspective what is the difference between an infant of three days and a Nestor of three generations?
time.author: Marcus Aurelius

time.quote: Think constantly how many doctors have died, after knitting their brows over their own patients how many astrologers, after predicting the deaths of others, as if death were something important; how many philosophers, after endless deliberation on death or immortality; how many heroes, after the many others they killed; how many tyrants, after using their power over men’s lives with monstrous insolence, as if they themselves were immortal. Think too how many whole cities have died – Helice, Pompeii, Herculaneum, innumerable others. Go over now all those you have known yourself, one after the other: one man follows a friend’s funeral and is then laid out himself, then another follows him – and all in a brief space of time. The conclusion of this? You should always look on human life as short and cheap. Yesterday sperm: tomorrow a mummy or ashes.So one should pass through this tiny fragment of time in tune with nature, and leave it gladly, as an olive might fall when ripe, blessing the earth which bore it and grateful to the tree which gave it growth.
time.author: Marcus Aurelius

time.quote: Time is the only constant, unique measure of human existence, abundant for those they value, scarce for those they do not.
time.author: Anand Patwa

time.quote: God takes time.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: COVID-19 is not a good time to be a cashier.
time.author: Steven Magee

time.quote: He looked away, at the patients playing Monopoly or watching cartoons or killing time as time killed them.
time.author: Emmbrancsxx0

time.quote: Time’s advantageous worth is extremely abysmal and the strength it possesses is beyond comprehension. A single preliminary minute may suffice one or one’s army to obtain a triumph. A split second is enough to guarantee you the universe’s treasures. A fraction of a second can make a difference between life and death and can determine your luck in the Lord’s will. " - Afraz Shaikh
time.author: Afraz Shaikh

time.quote: Life is too short. Show appreciation to the person you love. Let them know how you truly feel. Show them you care. Spend quality time with them, because you never know how long you will be with them.
time.author: De philosopher DJ Kyos

time.quote: it's just that you want to tell someone you love them when they are alive, but you don't because you take time for granted. And when time finally gets hold of you, wraps its deathly fingers over your throat and takes away the very thing you love, you realize that you should have done the needful a lot earlier
time.author: Kevin Missal

time.quote: By the time COVID-19 is over, the death toll will be comparable to war.
time.author: Steven Magee

time.quote: There is no particular time or space for happiness; it is life. Happiness won’t be found when you pursue it. When you think that you have to do something to be happy, you are setting conditions for happiness.
time.author: Raju Ramanathan

time.quote: Time has its dimensions in the mysterious.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: Somebody says, sorry I am very busy, means you are not very important to them. Everybody divides their time according to their priorities.
time.author: Biju Karakkonam Nature and Wildlife Photographer

time.quote: My undertaking is not difficult, essentially. I should only have to be immortal to carry it out.
time.author: Jorge Luis Borges

time.quote: Some novels even overdramatize events, which, in real life, happen in a far more unassuming and inconsequential way; they happen, then they're over, they run into one another, floating like clouds scattered by the wind between the odd deceptive pause that turns out to be impossible, because time—which no one understands—stops for nothing.
time.author: Enrique Vila-Matas

time.quote: None of us may want to claim to live life in two parallel lanes but all have many lives, one tucked beneath or right alongside the other. Some lives wait their turn because they haven't been lived at all, while others die before they've lived out their time, and some are waiting to be relived because they haven't been lived enough.
time.author: André Aciman

time.quote: There will be many orphaned children by the time the COVID-19 pandemic is over.
time.author: Steven Magee

time.quote: The French solved the problem of toilet paper shortages a long time ago and called it the ‘Bidet’.
time.author: Steven Magee

time.quote: Sense of time is the sixth sense.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: Right time is now to reflect.
time.author: Lailah Gifty Akita

time.quote: Everything changes, even time! But nothing, inclusive of time can change who God is.
time.author: Gift Gugu Mona

time.quote: All things fade and quickly turn to myth: quickly too utter oblivion drowns them. And I am talking of those who shone with some wonderful brilliance: the rest, once they have breathed their last, are immediately ‘beyond sigh, beyond knowledge’. But what in any case is everlasting memory? Utter emptiness.
time.author: Marcus Aurelius

time.quote: Time does this, sometimes -- pauses to appreciate an object of beauty. It grows so enamored that it forgets to move forward. A meadow or a clavicle or a painting might be the secret to immortality. Enough loveliness, & time will stop altogeher.
time.author: GennaRose Nethercott

time.quote: Time makes the whole world kin.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: Everything else has changed and disappeared with time, but not the painting. When we stand in front of it, we realise its significance, we bring it to life, we draw it into our own time and our own reality. Art works with the living, it attempts to grasp life in time, as it is in precisely this moment, and when it succeeds, life in time becomes timeless.
time.author: Karl Ove Knausgård

time.quote: Yet I stand, my back is arched Frederick Chopin, Funeral March Hands on the clock, they stop They wave, they smile and say my time is up
time.author: Soroosh Shahrivar

time.quote: And everyone is alive, somewhere in time.
time.author: Amal El-Mohtar

time.quote: Und wer die Zeit der Menschen besitzt, der hat unbegrenzte Macht!
time.author: Michael Ende

time.quote: Understanding that time is limited helps to motivate the use of each moment to the best advantage to achieve things of value.
time.author: Steven Redhead

time.quote: Maximizing time doesn't mean rushing around like there is no tomorrow.
time.author: Steven Redhead

time.quote: Technology is a wonderful thing, it brings everyone so closer that you can actually see the distance between them. The infinite distance.
time.author: Ratish Edwards

time.quote: Repeated enough times even the most obvious obnoxious lies become to seem like the truth.
time.author: Steven Redhead

time.quote: The aim of demanding quick responses or decisions is to limit time to consider options.
time.author: Steven Redhead

time.quote: Time appears to rush by without any concern for its impact upon you.
time.author: Steven Redhead

time.quote: The right thing at the right time only happens when we stop searching for the right time, everything becomes right when we decide to make it right, time never decides the choice & determination factor, it just moves on.
time.author: Shahenshah Hafeez Khan

time.quote: Speed is the whip of humanity. Speed is the enemy of the spirit. It whizzes through wisdom, tramples thought, and, instead, manufactures reflexes. It stabs art. It stifles friendship. Courtesy is no more where it reigns. It substitutes tension for attention. And kills enjoyment
time.author: Irina Goraïnoff

time.quote: A day can pass as A day ,A second,A year ... Thousands of years
time.author: Lara Zubaidia

time.quote: The major cost in life is the time wasted that can't possibly ever be replaced.
time.author: Steven Redhead

time.quote: Over a lifetime there are vast amounts of available time that on analysis are wasted.
time.author: Steven Redhead

time.quote: Time on the surface doesn't seem to cost anything, where in fact time costs a lifetime.
time.author: Steven Redhead

time.quote: Unlike a good wine knowledge or information doesn't age well, soon becoming obsolete or less valuable with the passing of time.
time.author: Steven Redhead

time.quote: Don’t be such people. There’s a time to let in and then no time ever to push away. When we enter, we stay and not make you go away. We fight the demons together, not against each other. A wrong remains a wrong for whatever eventual right reasons you think you’re doing it today.
time.author: Nitya Prakash

time.quote: Nothing is older than time. There is nothing newer than the present moment.
time.author: Rajesh`

time.quote: The flow of time stops for no one. Once a moment passes, you cannot go back and change it. Not with science, not with divine interventions.
time.author: Rajesh`

time.quote: We experience time by perceiving, through our senses, things that change. In a completely stationary world, the concept of time will not have any meaning.
time.author: Rajesh`

time.quote: Photons that travel at the speed of light must have no concept of time.
time.author: Rajesh`

time.quote: The most profound property of time is that nothing lasts forever. At the same time, time itself is probably eternal. Now, isn’t that a paradox to ponder over?
time.author: Rajesh`

time.quote: What started time? And how much time did that unknown phenomenon take to start time?
time.author: Rajesh`

time.quote: I guess my cognitive abilities and withering brain plasticity cannot grasp the placement of time as a dimension in an equally difficult-to-grasp theory of relativity.
time.author: Rajesh`

time.quote: Whereever we go, whatever we earnthe time we waste can never returnThe mistakes we've made are now to burninto the bonfire of guilt and wrongdoingWill we ever learn to stop pursuingthose temptations of life that minds are wooing?
time.author: Munia Khan

time.quote: To start succeeding in a specific area you need fucking huge action to take… to invest time… less eating… less sleep… less time wasting…
time.author: Deyth Banger

time.quote: And I am forty-nine and getting old and soon it will be too late for all the things I know nothing of but which torment me in the middle of the night and here now in this place which is supposed to be a comfort and a solace. I am lonely and hungry and I have never breathed a word of this to anyone. Nobody knows or cares. I don't want anyone to know or care.
time.author: Penelope Lively

time.quote: are they nothing at all, the cries of men?does nothing happen in time but time passing?-nothing happens, only the flickering eyelidof the great sun, hardly a movement, nothing,the unredeemable boundaries of time,the dead are all pinned down by their own dying,they cannot die again of another death,they are untouchable, locked in their gestures,and since their solitude and since their dyingthis only they can do: stare sightless at us,their death is simply the statue of their life,perpetual being and nothingness without end,for every moment is nothing without end,a king of fantasy regulates your pulseand your last gesture carves an impassive maskand lays that sculpture over your mobile face:we are the monument raised to an alienlife, a life unlived, not lively, hardly ours.
time.author: Octavio Paz

time.quote: Save that space because I need the time to disperse my rain. The day ahead is Still long yet, longer than the days behind and Weeks lost between, that we used to use to have discipline.
time.author: H.M. Reynolds

time.quote: Time takes everything away.
time.author: Ratish Edwards

time.quote: When you don’t reach out often or enough to those you care for, you’re silently announcing they’re not worth the effort or time. No amount of words or display of vulnerabilities thereafter can suffice. You’ve created a crack in something beautiful. If you value them, show it.
time.author: Nitya Prakash

time.quote: Suddenly it occurred to me that maybe the point of writing wasn't just to record something past but also to prolong the present, like in One Thousand and One Nights, to stretch out the time until the next thing happened.
time.author: Elif Batuman

time.quote: Taking time to relax every day, spending quality time with friends, and practicing mindfulness are some of the tried and tested ways of developing self-compassion.
time.author: Dr Prem Jagyasi

time.quote: Just as it takes time for the mud in muddy water to settle, meditation only yields fruit if it is practiced regularly for a long time.
time.author: Dr Prem Jagyasi

time.quote: Anything that makes you feel alive is worth devoting time to.
time.author: Dr Prem Jagyasi

time.quote: Take all the time you need to analyze your priorities, and accordingly, decide what is good for you.
time.author: Dr Prem Jagyasi

time.quote: We should always be ready to explore our positive and negative traits by evaluating our real self from time to time.
time.author: Dr Prem Jagyasi

time.quote: All human power is a compound of time and patience. Powerful beings will and wait.
time.author: Balzac Honore De

time.quote: The GiftBe still, my soul, and steadfast.Earth and heaven both are still watchingthough time is draining from the clockand your walk, that was confident and quick,has become slow.So, be slow if you must, but letthe heart still play its true part.love still as once you loved, deeplyand without patience. Let God and the worldknow you are grateful.That the gift has been given.
time.author: Mary Oliver

time.quote: It is the nature of trauma that, when left untreated, it deepens over time.
time.author: Dani Shapiro

time.quote: Yes, it is possible that we do not grow up, that even as we grow old, we remain the children we always were. We remember ourselves as we were then, and we feel ourselves to be the same. We made ourselves into what we are now then, and we remain what we were, in spite of the years. We do not change for ourselves. Time makes us grow old, but we do not change.
time.author: Paul Auster

time.quote: nostalgia will kill the good girl.the truth is you should not waste your time on being good.
time.author: Lisa Marie Basile

time.quote: Voksne venter på i morgen, bevæger sig i en nutid bag hvilken der er i går eller i forgårs eller højst sidste uge: Resten vil de ikke tænke på. Børn kender ikke betydningen af i går, af i forgårs eller sågar af i morgen, alt er lige nu; gaden er den, døråbningen er den, trapperne er dem, det er mor, det er far, det er dagen, det er natten.
time.author: Elena Ferrante

time.quote: Antipathy toward time clouds personal and collective thinking.
time.author: Marcia Bjornerud

time.quote: I did hundreds of interviews with people in retirement or approaching retirement. Here was their theme: 'I was waiting for a time when I’d have more time, education, experience or money to do what I wanted to do…only to find out when I got there that I still needed more time, more education, more experience and more money.
time.author: Richie Norton

time.quote: Miranda waited, then said, 'But what will I do for a whole year?'Neither of them answered her. She supposed the answer was, Get better. The thought of a slow and measured crawl back to health filled her with black sand.
time.author: Helen Oyeyemi

time.quote: Man is a tempted being, living with what he does and suffers in time, the medium in which he realizes his potential character. The indeterminacy of time means that events never happen once and for all. The good may fall, the bad may repent, and suffering can be, not a simple retribution, but a triumph.
time.author: W. H. Auden

time.quote: Till the time the chains of organized religion remain intact, the slavery of mind & soul will reign supreme.
time.author: Mamur Mustapha

time.quote: Accept it," Rakturan said. "I am different than the man you first met." "So quickly?" "What is time? A thousand years can pass in a single day.
time.author: Sarah K.L. Wilson

time.quote: Do you spend more time looking at your watch than living in the moment?
time.author: Frank Sonnenberg

time.quote: It’s not ‘time’ for God, for there was never a time that was not a time for Him. What it’s ‘time’ for is our realization that we’ve needed Him all the time and we just never took the time to realize that.
time.author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

time.quote: There are 86400 seconds in a day and how you use theseare critical. What you do today is to show who you are.Nobody's gonna talk about what you did last week. You have given this opportunity to be alivein your life time. It means absolutely nothingif you don't take advantage of it.
time.author: Maria Johnsen

time.quote: This impression is a glimpse not of timelessness but timefulness, an acute consciousness of how the world is made by - indeed, made of - time.
time.author: Marcia Bjornerud

time.quote: Time, a magic wand I needTo live again that moment whenI was a child and I was sureThat happiness is just a game,That when tomorrow I will wakeJust a few things I will needSun, some laughs and enough timeTo play, to stay forever young. No time to worry, no time to craveI must now enjoy the game.
time.author: Porumb Ana Diana

time.quote: Time is the one thing we can all agree to call supernatural.
time.author: Haldor Laxness

time.quote: I saw the priest take note of the time. What time was it? Then I felt his finger on my forehead. And I realized, whatever time it was, that it was the last moment of my life as an Episcopalian.
time.author: Lorena Cassady

time.quote: 1.Your personal identity over time is dependent on mental connectedness of your being at an earlier time and your being at a later time. If there is no right way for this connectivity, this will mean that your inner world as a whole system has already changed over a period of time and for that reason you are not yet the same person. Make it sure whether you have still the same personality or not before claiming that you are one and the same person.
time.author: Elmar Hussein

time.quote: Time is fractal. The density if time is a nested hierarchy of possibility.
time.author: R.A. Delmonico

time.quote: When you find yourself lonely when you’re with them, it is time to leave.
time.author: Nitya Prakash

time.quote: Just give it time.'' ''Time is the only thing I don't have.
time.author: Laura Lesniak

time.quote: Your addiction is not you, but it feels like you because you’ve spent so much intimate time together.
time.author: Toni Sorenson

time.quote: You want it or not but with time, memories are going to fade. Wounds will be healed and life will give you plenty opportunities to be happy.
time.author: Nitya Prakash

time.quote: There is no beginning and end of a moment in time.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: What is time? Who can explain this easily and briefly? Who can comprehend this even in thought so as to articulate the answer in words? Yet what do we speak of, in our familiar everyday conversation, more than of time? We surely know what we mean when we speak of it. We also know what is meant when we hear someone else talking about it. What then is time? Provided that no one asks me, I know. If I want to explain it to an inquirer, I do not know. But I confidently affirm myself to know that if nothing passes away, there is no past time, and if nothing arrives, there is no future time, and if nothing existed there would be no present time. Take the two tenses, past and future. How can they 'be' when the past is not now present and the future is not yet present? Yet if the present were always present, it would not pass into the past: it would not be time but eternity. If then, in order to be time at all, the present is so made that it passes into the past, how can we say that this present also 'is'? The cause of its being is that it will cease to be. So indeed we cannot truly say that time exists except in the sense that it tends toward non-existence.
time.author: Augustine of Hippo

time.quote: <...> чтобы показать им, что такое настоящее тремоло. Самому же Глебу оно напоминало время: было таким же ровным и поглощало ноты так же, как время – события.
time.author: Inga Knysh

time.quote: THE RAIN CAN'T STOP, TIME KEEPS CLICKING
time.author: Jordan Hoechlin

time.quote: Do you know my dragon?' I ask.'I do,' she says, 'and it is time we get him out of your head. He doesn't belong there.
time.author: Jan Esh & Stephen Nauta

time.quote: [Introverts] are also more flexible in a sense, in that sometimes they must do what extraverts do all the time, meet strangers and go to parties. But some extraverted people can avoid being introverted, turning inward, for years at a time.
time.author: Elaine N. Aron

time.quote: We have more story than time to tell it - but I suppose that's true for all of us.
time.author: Courtney Summers

time.quote: Every time I see a baby my heart dances with joy and my mind appreciates her for taking us into the distant future.
time.author: ApolloM

time.quote: Whatever the claims of memes to be regarded as replicators in the same sense as genes, the first part of this chapter established that individual organisms are not replicators.
time.author: Richard Dawkins

time.quote: Always take time to celebrate achievements whether great or small
time.author: Charmaine J. Forde

time.quote: Do not let the mortality of a moment hold you back from living an eternity in that time.
time.author: Sherry Namdeo

time.quote: She stared at me, like day stares at an hourglass and night, the sand trickling through time; the sea disappearing to eyes in the dark. But I hear her waves coming in, as she whispers one last chance goodbye.
time.author: Anthony Liccione

time.quote: It was the happiest time of my life. I was useful, I was learning, I was away from my father. I look back at that time with extreme fondness. It seems rather far away now, but that is what age does. Time is such a villain.
time.author: Michelle Franklin

time.quote: When you take time to be kind to others-you're being kind to yourself also
time.author: Charmaine J. Forde

time.quote: Kindness is invaluable,Take time to be kind to others
time.author: Charmaine J. Forde

time.quote: Время Глеб открыл для себя лет в 13-14. Еще недавно оно не двигалось, было, можно сказать, вечностью, а теперь всё изменилось. Сначала воникли годы, и каждый из них был особенным в том числе, что не имел ничего общего с другими годами. Словно бы прилетал из космоса, безродный и непредсказуемый. А этот, последний год неожиданно нашел для себя ряд. Он был зависим от предыдущим лет и определял характер лет последующих. И вообще не был бескрайним, как прежние годы.
time.author: INGA KNYSH

time.quote: The practice of staying present will heal you. Obsessing about how the future will turn out creates anxiety. Replaying broken scenarios from the past causes anger or sadness. Stay here, in the moment.
time.author: Sylvester McNutt III

time.quote: People are no longer afraid of him.The spirit and the time are with him. (Il ne fait plus peur. L'esprit et le temps sont avec lui.)
time.author: Charles de Leusse

time.quote: Then for a brief moment he saw everything completely differently. Open space, empty and endless, stretched away in all "directions. Everything within this dead expanse, every living thing was helpless and alone. Things were happening by accident, and when the accident failed, automatic law appeared – the rhythmical machinery of nature, the cogs and pistons of history, conformity with the rules that was rotting from the inside and crumbling to dust. Cold and sorrow reigned everywhere. Every creature was trying to huddle up to something, to cling to something, to things, to each other, but all that resulted was suffering and despair.The quality of what Izydor saw was temporality. Under a colourful outer coating everything was merging in collapse, decay, and destruction.
time.author: Olga Tokarczuk

time.quote: ...she says, Even when you think you can't bear it, you can bear it. He doesn't say anything. Sometimes you have to let time carry you past your troubles, she says. Believe me. I have been where you are.
time.author: Lauren Groff

time.quote: Grief as a low-grade fever. His sadness is a hive at the back of his head: he moves slowly to keep from being stung. Things bunch together, smooth endlessly out.
time.author: Lauren Groff

time.quote: They continued across the seemingly endless sands, watering every grain with their sweat, anointing every granule with their strain. In the hourglass of time the sands continued to shift, and they couldn't find their way outside the glass. Their shadows struggled with them, hauling and heaving, dropping with them, and clambering up with them, and reminding them constantly that otherwise they were alone.
time.author: Dean F. Wilson

time.quote: The Road BackThe car is heavy with childrentugged back from summer,swept out of their laughing beach,swept out while a persistent rumourtells them nothing ends.Today we fret and pullon wheels, ignore our regular lossof time, count cows and otherswhile the sun moves overlike an old albatrosswe must not count nor kill.There is no word for time.Today we willnot think to number another summeror watch its white bird into the groundToday, all cars,all fathers, all mothers, allchildren and lovers willhave to forget about that thing in the sky,going aroundlike a persistent rumour that will get us yet.
time.author: Anne Sexton

time.quote: If you want to save time, be honest. If you want to save your life, be courageous.
time.author: Maxime Lagacé

time.quote: The ancient and the modern blended together in haunting harmony. The war looked like a dream here; a fantasy dwarfed by the sands of time.
time.author: Zita Steele

time.quote: The kid was swell. He was walking in the street, instead of on the sidewalk, but right next to the curb. He was making out like he was walking a very straight line, the way kids do, and the whole time he kept singing and humming. I got up closer so I could hear what he was singing. He was singing that song, 'If a body catch a body coming through the rye.' He had a pretty little voice, too. He was just singing for the hell of it, you could tell. The cars zoomed by, brakes screeched all over the place, his parents paid no attention to him, and he kept on walking next to the curb and singing 'If a body catch a body coming through the rye.' It made me feel better. It made me feel not so depressed any more.
time.author: J.D. Salinger

time.quote: Time is the mother of all fundamental forces of nature.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: Time is the mother of dimensions.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: The proper study of God is the nature of time.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: Time will heal all our wounds, vengeance will fix our scars.
time.author: Mecha Constantine

time.quote: Then she’d straightened up and announced in irritation, "I’ve fallen out of time," before vanishing in a great cloud of smoke.
time.author: Naomi Novik

time.quote: Patience is a byproduct of growth - we can bide our time when it is the time of our growth. There is no patience in acquisition or in the pursuit of power and fame. Nothing is so impatient as the pursuit of a substitute for growth.
time.author: Eric Hoffer

time.quote: Don't wait for the coffee or the eggs or the shmuck in the front row to tell you how it is. You'll wait your whole life and then end up in an embankment with a heart full of sorrow and I could have done it betters.The way I see it, time is a con artist. The con artist telling you that this isn't a good time, you should wait. The right time will never exist. Like so many of the things we think are perfect and in the end turn out to be just ordinary.
time.author: Jennifer Pastiloff

time.quote: Time is relative. It is both arriving and passing away.
time.author: ~ Meeta Ahluwalia

time.quote: When we give our attention and love to anything in life, it is a significant offering. We only have so much time. What we spend it on and who we give it to will determine the course of our life.
time.author: Donna Goddard

time.quote: ...Nicholai bir yıl boyunca olup bitenin farkına varmadı. Günlük yaşamı bir sürü küçük olaylarla noktalanıp ölçülüyor, cezaevi dışındaki yaşamla da hiçbir ilgisi kalmamış bulunuyordu. Hiçbir zaman canı sıkılmamıştı. Fizik kurallarına ters görünen bir ilke vardı çünkü. Zaman ancak, içi boş olduğu zaman ağırdı.
time.author: Trevanian

time.quote: Kai laiko turi be galo, niekas nebėra ypatinga. Be netekčių ar aukos mes nesugebame įvertinti to, ką turime.
time.author: Mitch Albom

time.quote: -Dievas riboja mūsų dienų skaičių ne be priežasties.-Kokia to priežastis?-Kad kiekviena diena būtų brangi.
time.author: Mitch Albom

time.quote: Music is about time,’ I told her. ‘It is about controlling time.
time.author: Matt Haig

time.quote: It is time to end the insanity that calls itself very high altitude astronomy.
time.author: Steven Magee

time.quote: We can afford to waste most things, but not time.
time.author: Rajesh`

time.quote: I wish I could unpick the stitches of time that have become all tangled and twisted together.
time.author: Sally Gardner

time.quote: Pero siempre hay tiempo de cambiar. Siempre hay tiempo. Hasta que ya no hay.
time.author: M.T. Anderson

time.quote: It is time to demolish the biologically toxic Mauna Kea Observatories (MKO).
time.author: Steven Magee

time.quote: Esiste qualcosa di eterno?Qualcosa che possiamo seppellire in noi così profondamente da non poterlo più strisciare da nessuno schermo; qualcosa che riesca a conservarsi indenne nonostante il tempo, il rumore, l'incuria, gli attacchi?Gli andrebbe bene anche una cosa piccola, anche triste.Gli andrebbe bene anche se non fosse sua. Gli basterebbe sapere che esiste.
time.author: Eleonora C. Caruso

time.quote: He often caught himself living in the mistaken belief that transformation was the same thing as progress. Things could look very different while remain the same: time could seem to have altered everything, without changing the thing that needed to change.
time.author: Rachel Cusk

time.quote: The prison of time is truly fascinating; the decisions you wish you could undo played a part in bringing you here and empowering you to wish they could be undone.
time.author: Paul

time.quote: The most painful moments make us truly want to escape from time, but the most profound joy rarely makes us hold on to time forever.
time.author: Paul the cynic

time.quote: It needs EFFORTS to catch time on time!
time.author: Shayana Kaushal

time.quote: But I must start at the beginning, if I can find it. Beginnings are elusive things. Just when you think you have hold of one, you look back and see another, earlier beginning, and an earlier one before that. Even if you start with "Chapter One: I Am Born, " you still have the problem of antecedents, of cause and effect...
time.author: Hillary Jordan

time.quote: No one willingly turns his thought back to the past, unless all his acts have been submitted to the censorship of his conscience, which is never deceived; he who has ambitiously coveted, proudly scorned, recklessly conquered, treacherously betrayed, greedily seized, or lavishly squandered, must needs fear his own memory.
time.author: Seneca

time.quote: The smart phone is a really amazing device, but it is a bad idea to hold one next to your brain for extended periods of time.
time.author: Steven Magee

time.quote: Time keeps me going.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: Time and effort can get you anything you want in the world. But nothing in the world can get you more time.
time.author: Matt Fox

time.quote: But those who forget the past, neglect the present, and fear for the future have a life that is very brief and troubled; when they have reached the end of it, the poor wretches perceive too late that for such a long while they have been busied in doing nothing.
time.author: Seneca

time.quote: It is disappointing to witness the corporate government disability system letting massive numbers of sickened people down during their greatest time of need.
time.author: Steven Magee

time.quote: People get a lot of time to waste and a little to invest.
time.author: Junaid Raza

time.quote: [T]he elementary form of the mechanics of the world...does not need to mention 'time.' The world without a time variable is not a complicated one. It's a net of interconnected events, where the variables in play adhere to probabilistic rules that, incredibly, we know for a good part how to write. And it's a clear world, windswept and full of beauty as the crests of mountains; aridly beautiful as the cracked lips of the adolescent you loved.
time.author: Carlo Rovelli

time.quote: Two o’clock was missing.
time.author: Tara Sim

time.quote: Ce matin, l'idée m'est venue pour la première fois que mon corps, ce fidèle compagnon, cet ami plus sûr, mieux connu de moi que mon âme, n'est qu'un monstre sournois qui finira par dévorer son maître.
time.author: Marguerite Yourcenar

time.quote: Genealogy becomes a mania, an obsessive struggle to penetrate the past and snatch meaning from an infinity of names. At some point the search becomes futile – there is nothing left to find, no meaning to be dredged out of old receipts, newspaper articles, letters, accounts of events that seemed so important fifty or seventy years ago. All that remains is the insane urge to keep looking, insane because the searcher has no idea what he seeks. What will it be? A photograph? A will? A fragment of a letter? The only way to find out is to look at everything, because it is often when the searcher has gone far beyond the border of futility that he finds the object he never knew he was looking for.
time.author: Henry Wiencek

time.quote: For Heidegger, boredom is a privileged fundamental mood because it leads us directly into the very problem complex of being and time.
time.author: Lars Fr. H. Svendsen

time.quote: Our mind has its own ideal time, which is no other but the consciousness of the progressive development of our beings.
time.author: August Wilhelm Schlegel

time.quote: The diaries of opium-eaters record how, during the brief period of ecstasy, the drugged person's dreams have a temporal scope of ten, thirty, sometimes sixty years or even surpass all limits of man's ability to experience time--dreams, that is, whose imaginary time span vastly exceeds their actual duration and which are characterized by an incredible diminishment of the experience of time, with images thronging past so swiftly that, as one hashish-smoke puts it, the intoxicated user's brain seems "to have something removed, like the mainspring from a broken watch.
time.author: Thomas Mann

time.quote: The Earth is a very small stage in a vast cosmic arena. Think of the rivers of blood spilled by all those generals and emperors so that, in glory and triumph, they could become the momentary masters of a fraction of a dot. Think of the endless cruelties visited by the inhabitants of one corner of this pixel on the scarcely distinguishable inhabitants of some other corner, how frequent their misunderstandings, how eager they are to kill one another, how fervent their hatreds.
time.author: Carl Sagan

time.quote: No really. If you only have seven years left, that means the Reaper will be dropping round for tea and buns in about 61,000 hours from now. You therefore shouldn’t be wasting time by pootling to the garden centre at walking pace. So come on, grandad. The clock’s ticking. Pedal to the metal. Or you’ll be in your flowerbed before the plants you bought.
time.author: Jeremy Clarkson

time.quote: I must reluctantly observe that two causes, the abbreviation of time, and the failure of hope, will always tinge with a browner shade the evening of life.
time.author: Edward Gibbon

time.quote: We repeatedly tell patients we are not in a hurry; there are no trains to catch and we don't care when the baby comes, only how! A doctor who is in a hurry does not belong in the field of obstetrics. As my chief pointed out, 'An obstetrician should have a big rear end and the good sense to sit calmly thereupon and let nature take its course.
time.author: Robert A. Bradley

time.quote: Bruno withdrew from the field of history more resolutely than Vigo; that is why I prefer the former’s retrospect but the latter’s prospect. As an anarch, I am determined to go along with nothing, ultimately take nothing seriously – at least not nihilistically, but rather as a border guard in no man’s land, who sharpens his eyes and ears between the tides.
time.author: Ernst Jünger

time.quote: Confronted with the choice between having time and having things, we’ve chosen to have things. Today it is a luxury to read what Socrates said, not because the books are expensive, but because our time is scarce.
time.author: Gabriel Zaid

time.quote: You know the horrible life of the alarm clock – it’s a monster that has always appalled me because of the number of things its eyes project, and the way that good fellow stares at me when I enter a room.
time.author: Jacques Vache

time.quote: He had never been a social man. He had shunned causes with contempt and disgust. They were for pig-simple suckers and people with too much time and money on their hands
time.author: Stephen King

time.quote: When I sit up I am greeted by the world. Level with the treetops I look down on sparrows swooping in and out of the branches. The tide, the new rising moon, the clouds, the wind - these greet me. These are my allies. The whole planet is laid out before me and available for whatever adventure the day will take me on. By comparison, living in society seems to require an alarm clock. Primarily assembled from angst and fish anuses, these contraptions, regardless of your soul's whereabouts, will slap and assault you into a pitiful state of what passes for consciousness. Your first sight is the Time, an arragement of molecules on the clock's face to whom you will be enslaved for the rest of the day. You may as well call him "master." Next, a pile of dirty clothes on the floor, a knocked-over glass of water, and so forth, until you are so overwhelmed with despair that to prevent hurling yourself through the window, you must ignore your personal bill of rights, put on an acceptable frown, and go about your business, disregarding the pleas from you increasingly timid soul.
time.author: Daniel Hays

time.quote: What a greater crime. Than loss of time.
time.author: Thomas Tusser

time.quote: Contemporary' was in those days [1953] synonymous with 'modern' as it had not been before and is not now [1977].
time.author: A.S. Byatt

time.quote: Changes is the mother of time. Absence of changes makes no time.
time.author: Toba Beta

time.quote: The dusty tombs of long-dead exorcist priests lay in the alcoves below, surmounted by stone effigies, the features eroded by the passing of time and the reverent caresses of their grateful parishioners, a reminder, she knew all too well, of the brevity of life.
time.author: Sarah Ash

time.quote: Time and space are awash here.
time.author: Jerome Lawrence

time.quote: [D]as Gedächtnis [ist] schwach und der Lauf eines Lebens kurz und alles [geschieht] so rasch, dass wir den Zusammenhang zwischen den Ereignissen nicht mehr sehen, die Folgen der Taten nicht mehr ermessen können, wir glauben an die Fiktion der Zeit, an Gegenwart, Vergangenheit und Zukunft, aber es kann auch sein, dass alles gleichzeitig geschieht [...]
time.author: Isabel Allende

time.quote: He noticed Miss Bettie was wearing a watch, a steel Rolex with diamond chips. "What time is it?" he asked. Miss Bettie glanced at him and laughed. "You do seem to have difficulty remembering, don't you? Well, then, I shall tell you. It's now, Joshua Cane. Always and only now.
time.author: Sean Stewart

time.quote: Still men be clever and in an hundred centuries or more, perchance will have found a way to journey thither; when that they have discovered and understood all things on the earth. What will a man be like in the xxvii century, or even the xx? Very like unto us, I do expect; I do not think that man’s nature shall change; nor do I anticipate that he will be the wiser than we, for all his learning, for ‘tis a part of that nature which is ours that we do not heed the lessons of history: neither our own, nor the world’s.
time.author: Chico Kidd

time.quote: There is no necessity to live by the clock.
time.author: Patricia Clapp

time.quote: On the church vaulting above was the clock-face of eternity, void of number and serving as its own hand, only one black finger was pointing and the dead wanted to tell the time by it.
time.author: Jean Paul

time.quote: Chronotropic Drugs:Drugs engineered to affect one's sense of time. Chronodecelocotropic drugs have no short term effect but over time give one the impression that time feels longer. Chronoaccelocotropic drugs have the opposite effect.
time.author: Douglas Coupland

time.quote: Pensa-se de dia – a – dia. Se começamos a pensar no futuro, no nosso futuro pessoal, perdemos a coragem. E, de repente, lembramo-nos de todas as coisas que fizemos e que foram um desperdício de tempo… os minutos que desperdiçámos e que nunca podemos reaver. E apercebemo-nos de que o tempo é a coisa mais preciosa de todas. Porque o tempo é a vida. É a única coisa que nunca podemos recuperar. É possível perder uma rapariga e quem sabe voltar a conquistá-la… ou encontrar outra. Mas um segundo, este segundo, quando se vai, é irreversível.
time.author: Jacqueline Susann

time.quote: We are all inmates and doing our time in the prison called ‘world
time.author: Honeya

time.quote: You stay in the triumph of the Past,I will enjoy the Nothingness of Today!
time.author: Somya Kedia

time.quote: Don't think you're wasting time by things like playing solitaire--it's good therapy to give your brain a break now and then.
time.author: Anna Balcsik

time.quote: We are not born with tears. Your first dozen cries are dry. It takes some time for the world to arrive and salt the eyes.
time.author: Kevin Young

time.quote: Children force parents to go out looking for a specific pulse, a gaze, a rhythm, the right way of telling the story, knowing that stories don't fix anything or save anyone but maybe make the world both more complex and more tolerable. And sometimes, just sometimes, more beautiful. Stories are a way of subtracting the future from the past, the only way of finding clarity in hindsight.
time.author: Valeria Luiselli

time.quote: It seems unforgiving when a good thing endsBut you and I will always be back then
time.author: Rebecca Sugar

time.quote: He remarked as much to Charlotte on his return, and she was inclined to agree with him. 'As life draws us along,' she replied, 'we think we are acting of our own volition, ourselves choosing what we shall do and what we shall enjoy; but when we look more closely we see they are only the intentions and inclinations of the age which we are being compelled to comply with.
time.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

time.quote: What the point of crying over the things you don't have. Be patience and make the best of what you have. In TIME, great things will come.
time.author: Wazim Shaw

time.quote: We are all guilty, time is the executioner.
time.author: Andrzej Majewski

time.quote: All we know is that things happen. More accurately, God is the urging-forward force within all things, and all things (if "things" can be spoken of at all) are alive. The ontological matrix is a way in which His urging or thinking is manifested; so in that respect I think it’s not time which moves forward, carrying us with it like a great tide, but that we are driven forward all of us together, animate and inanimate.
time.author: Philip K. Dick

time.quote: when the time comes, you'll fall in love sweeties, don't rush.
time.author: Renesmee Stormer

time.quote: He had never seen anyone live so magically and yet leave no trace of it until he met her.
time.author: Akshay Vasu

time.quote: The Lord said: "Time [death] I am, the destroyer of the worlds, who has come to annihilate everyone. Even without your taking part all those arrayed in the [two] opposing ranks will be slain!
time.author: Krishna-Dwaipayana Vyasa

time.quote: Relationships develop best in the absence of a previously stated goal and a strict timetable, but relationship management means setting goals and creating a plan.
time.author: Monica Bakker

time.quote: The poet after all belongs himself to an age and country. Shakespeare must attempt to present the universal in terms of Elizabethan England.
time.author: Frederick Clarke Prescott

time.quote: Gret works of literature are always developed and enriched from age to age with the growth of thought.
time.author: Frederick Clarke Prescott

time.quote: The dreamer, while he is dreaming certainly, does not question his dream. It is the same with the matter of time.
time.author: Frederick Clarke Prescott

time.quote: Our conception of time is based intirely upon our ordinary conscious thought.
time.author: Frederick Clarke Prescott

time.quote: Time has no present or future, it is always the past.
time.author: Joey Lawsin

time.quote: As the poetic vision is timeless so the poetic product tends to be so.
time.author: Frederick Clarke Prescott

time.quote: Le monde s'agite, [...] il réclame la justice et non la pitié,son dû et non vos aumônes; [...] il pense mal parce qu'il ne pense plus vôtre, et pourtant il pense, il vit, infiniment plus vaste que ce coin de terre isolé par des haies, il vit, et nous n'en savons rien, [...] il vit, et nous allons mourir.
time.author: Hervé Bazin

time.quote: The time which we have at our disposal every day is elastic; the passions expand it, those that we inspire contract it; and habit fills up what remains.
time.author: Marcel Proust

time.quote: The simple fact of being a human being is you migrate. Many of us move from one place to the other. But even those who don't move and you stay in the same city, if you were born in Manhattan 70 years ago, you're born in Des Moines 70 years ago, you've lived in the same place for 70 years, the city you live in today is unrecognizable. Almost everything has changed. So even people who stay in the same place undergo a kind of migration through time. And in the novel, what I'm trying to explore is how everyone is a migrant.
time.author: Mohsin Hamid

time.quote: Time: the critic for whom nothing is ever good enough.
time.author: Marty Rubin

time.quote: Write as if Time will erase every word.
time.author: Marty Rubin

time.quote: Things changing is what defines time: atoms vibrate; clocks tick; the earth circles the Sun; the universe expands.
time.author: K.C. Cole

time.quote: Muscles relax, the mind expands. The vastness enters into the skin like a shot. ‘Our’ time dissolves.
time.author: Arianna Dagnino

time.quote: ... er tida en sekk du kan stappe inn i hvor mye som helst, går den aldri bare herfra til dit, men i stedet i sirkel etter sirkel, og så kommer du tilbake hver eneste gang til stedet hvor du begynte.Men det var ikke sånn heller. Før var jeg ung, nå var jeg ikke ung. Jeg ble aldri ung igjen.
time.author: Per Petterson

time.quote: Energy is variation per unit of time at a particular scale.Dimensions and scale are not static. Dimensions could be virtual like the idea of virtual particles but are a form of wave propagation.
time.author: R.A. Delmonico

time.quote: Time has a really incredible way of dulling feelings that you think will be sharp for your entire life. One day you wake up, and sometimes it takes something like this for that to happen, but you realize that the point isn't so pointy. And the edge isn't so jagged. And you find in your heart a way to accept people for who they are, because it's not always entirely their fault.
time.author: Susie Orman Schnall

time.quote: Something changed in the world. Not too long ago, it changed, and we know it. We don't know how to explain it yet, but I think we all can feel it, somewhere deep in our gut or in our brain circuits. We feel time differently. No one has quite been able to capture what is happening or say why. Perhaps it's just that we sense an absence of future, because the present has become too overwhelming, so the future has become unimaginable. And without future, time feels like only an accumulation.
time.author: Valeria Luiselli

time.quote: The mountains stand as if they have been there since the beginning of time.
time.author: Foster Kinn

time.quote: শিকড়ের সন্ধান আমাদের এক ঝুরঝুরে অন্ধকারের দিকে নামিয়ে এনেছে
time.author: Rik Amrit

time.quote: They are pleased to deceive themselves, as if they deceived Fate at the same time.
time.author: Seneca

time.quote: The vexing thing about time," he says, "is that it’s never enough. Perhaps a decade too short, perhaps a moment. But a life always ends too soon.
time.author: V.E. Schwab

time.quote: It was in my twenties that I felt old, that was when time was an abrasive wheel grinding me down. But it was not so much death I feared as insignificance.
time.author: Arthur  Miller

time.quote: Sitting inside the train of Time, we wonder, "Where is it going? What is the purpose of all this?" When we float out of it and experience Timelessness, we realize that there is no coming, no going. Then we come back into the train and start asking the same question.
time.author: Shunya

time.quote: We are slaves of Time. So we have inherent tendency to become master of others. Even in a family, a power play goes on in the name of love and duty (between parents-children, husband-wife). We must thank the pet dogs for absorbing this tendency of human beings and making home environment healthier.
time.author: Shunya

time.quote: When you allocate yourself time, it is always easier to manage.
time.author: DON SANTO

time.quote: The night is itself without narrative – the way the hours move, less like a stream flowing somewhere and more like water swilling in a shallow pool, until suddenly the pool is drained and it’s morning.
time.author: Samantha Harvey

time.quote: Not having money is time consuming. There are hours spent at laundromats, hours at bus stops, hours at free clinics, hours at thrift stores, hours on the phone with the bank or the credit card company or the phone company over some fee, some little charge, some mistake
time.author: Eula Biss

time.quote: October 2020 was by far the most interesting time of President Trump’s time in office.
time.author: Steven Magee

time.quote: All strife passes in time.
time.author: C.A.A. Savastano

time.quote: What about young age? You will be miserable all through your 15years to reach that goal of $10 million. After 50 years, even if youpay a million to get back a week of your time at 35, you will neverget that. Your beer will taste very different when you are at 50 fromhow it tasted at 30," Richita argued.
time.author: Ravindra Shukla

time.quote: Let your passage through time be prayerful praise.
time.author: Lailah Gifty Akita

time.quote: They were supposed to wait an hour or so before handling the plates, but, always impulsive, Alice couldn't help herself. She snuck one into her palm, knowing that if she was caught her aunt would lecture her about how Patience and Time were the lost twin sisters of the other muses, the extra ones no one ever talks about (as compared to the more showy ones like Terpsichore and Urania).
time.author: Liz Braswell

time.quote: Time is the thing that breaks apart life from death, eases apart their embrace. Time, not life, is what we live. Time, not life, is what runs out. Time pushes death over there, where we can see it, and then offers itself as finite protection.
time.author: Samantha Harvey

time.quote: Time!! When bad is the best revealer. It strips the people naked and reveals to you their true colours.
time.author: Muzaffar mir

time.quote: If we observe young children, it is clear that they intuitively understand that time spent in play is never time wasted. A lesson that seems to get lost the older we become.
time.author: Michelle Ogundehin

time.quote: NOT ONE CREASE IT STRAIGHTENSALCOHOL WASTES TIME INSIDE MEएक भी सलवट नहीं जो वो निकाल देती होशराब मेरे सिर्फ़ अंदर वक़्त बर्बाद करती हैEK BHI SALVAT NAHIN JOH WOH NIKAL DETI HOSHARAB MERE ANDAR WAQT BARBAD KARTI HAI4 October National Vodka Day
time.author: Vineet Raj Kapoor

time.quote: Stop wasting your breath. Stop chasing those who don't matter. There is someone out there waiting to take your breath away.
time.author: Christine E. Szymanski

time.quote: Time is river, it washes away much of our endeavors and sins often.
time.author: C.A.A. Savastano

time.quote: We also finally come to a fitting and thrilling discovery at the end of it: that the Bible is not just an evolved book containing the words of God, it is an astonishing record counting down — or up — to the end — or beginning of time. A recording from the very beginning to the very end then to another beginning, for all mankind. Time as we know it, we shall discover, does not really apply to Jesus.
time.author: Joseph Hannington

time.quote: Life requires work, planning, and progression to keep in step with future growth. But it is the appreciation of time that makes our life invaluable. In doing so, time is temporarily halted, captured in the moments colored by the beauty and love that surrounds us.Take the time to enjoy the view. Don't sweat the small stuff. Focus on what's important in life and try not to let time dictate the pace of the journey.
time.author: Judith Cosby

time.quote: The love of old things is a way of respecting time.
time.author: Wu Ming-Yi

time.quote: In each life, there come moments that feel as though they are a seashell from centuries ago caught and preserved in stone. All that is beautiful is there in full detail. And we are allowed to marvel as though time isn’t slipping away from us, as though it will always be here, in our hands. That’s how Helen felt as she cradled the newborn in her arms and looked down at his tiny sleeping face.
time.author: Corinne Beenfield

time.quote: The truth is it takes effort to do the right thing. It takes time to do it right. And it takes courage to get results
time.author: Asuni LadyZeal

time.quote: Will the same day ever come back, and with it Our amazement at having been in it, or will only a dark haze Spread at the back of the mind, erasing events, one after The other, so brief they may have been lost to begin with?
time.author: Mark Strand

time.quote: Time is the gift God has given us. It gives us perspective. Allows our emotions to settle and tempers to cool.
time.author: Susan Anne Mason

time.quote: If it matters, let me whisper a secret in your ears: I have always felt that I was in the wrong place and the wrong time. I am forever out of time and out of place.
time.author: Louis Yako

time.quote: A man or woman is free when they can choose how to spend their time.
time.author: Marty Rubin

time.quote: Wrinkles are the geometries that time puts on a person's face.
time.author: Corina Abdulahm Negura

time.quote: There’s a misconception that grief is about "looking backward," mourning someone whose life has been reduced to memories. But grief is also about "looking forward," realizing and grieving all the future events that your loved one will never get to participate in. Grief is half about mourning the past that was and half about mourning the future that never will be. You’re not weird or crazy for jumping months, years, or decades ahead to envision a life without your loved one present. In fact, when loss happens, we often feel like we’re losing everything all at once—past, present, and future. Sometimes in these moments, it’s comforting to know that while your loved one can no longer follow you into the future, your memories and love for them can.
time.author: Shelby Forsythia

time.quote: The media and its indubitable legitimisations would echo for keeps, too, its conveyance of darkness and in the know of unhackneyed minds, acute to this stinky fog, we who have descended to the sapience of hatred, thinking it warrantable, would be inseparable from the vile.
time.author: Adeosun Olamide

time.quote: Time is a concept invented by men who didn’t want everything to keep happening at once. Time is irrelevant.
time.author: Seanan McGuire

time.quote: I shiver: whose feet are walking on my grave? Time, I plead to the air, just a little more time. That's all I need.
time.author: Margaret Atwood

time.quote: Time doesn’t measure friendship, bonds and feelings do.
time.author: Tamuna Tsertsvadze

time.quote: Time is an illusion. It is a limitation created by our minds. If we stop measuring everything and just enjoy every moment given, life is going to be a lot more exciting.
time.author: Tamuna Tsertsvadze

time.quote: Again, the terror, the acknowledgment of wasted years and death. Valentin, responsive and confident, still nestled in his arms. His cheek touched the soft cheek and felt the brush of the delicate eyelashes. With inner desperation he pressed the child close - as though an emotion as protean as his love could dominate the pulse of time.
time.author: Carson McCullers

time.quote: Many people really want to develop themselves, but not too many are alacritous to work at it.
time.author: Previledge Tafadzwa Makaza

time.quote: Anything can break at any time.
time.author: Steven Magee

time.quote: I thought again about the miracle of time, its manifest cruelty and sublime mercy.
time.author: Kate Mulgrew

time.quote: The time has come, to stand up and to defy.Its our life, our choices, how long can they deny?The time has come, not to believe in every lie.Not to follow every rule, without asking why.The time has come, not to ignore as others cry.Or soon, very soon, it will be our turn to die.The time has come, not to turn a blind eye. Because once lost, freedom is hard to come by.
time.author: Shon Mehta

time.quote: There’s a Chinese saying. ‘When is the best time to plan a tree? Twenty years ago.
time.author: Richard Powers

time.quote: Patience shall be my song.
time.author: Thomas Wyatt

time.quote: It was a time of youth and war, and there was never so much love around.
time.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

time.quote: Patience shall be my song,
time.author: Sir Thomas Wyatt

time.quote: It is wrong to say that "time is limited". Actually, life is limited, not time!
time.author: Md. Ziaul Haque

time.quote: Time Creates Space, Life, Consciousness, and the Universe itself.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: এটা বলা ভুল যে "সময় সীমিত"। আসলে জীবন সীমিত, সময় নয়!
time.author: Md. Ziaul Haque

time.quote: The real currency of your life is effort, best measured in the extra time you put in.
time.author: J.R. Rim

time.quote: Time Is Reality. Reality is time.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: Life is clear-cut a dimension of time.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: LIFE IS A TIME JOURNEY
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: Productivity is purposeful doing. It is paying attention to your intention to ensure that what you’re doing is worth your time and energy. Will the outcome be worth your investment?
time.author: Melissa Steginus

time.quote: An ultimate extreme level of a moment in time is nothing but "Nothing" or Nothingness. The opposite of time is not Nothing, it's another time. Nothing is not the opposite of something, but a part of it. And, Nothing is not the opposite of time, but a part of it. That is, Time existed before Big Bang. There was absolute "Time" before the Big Bang.
time.author: Khalid Masood

time.quote: Heads fall off from time to timeSome of them old, some of them young The conductor hollers into the crowd:'Keep moving forward to the back!
time.author: Sankha Ghosh

time.quote: Heads fall off from time to timeSome of them old, some of them youngThe conductor hollers into the crowd:'Keep moving forward to the back!
time.author: Indrajit Hazra

time.quote: I spend a whole lot of time in a whole lot of places that don’t do me a whole lot of good, when God has spent a whole lot of time inviting me to spend the whole of eternity with Him.
time.author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

time.quote: Time, an invaluable perception of reality.
time.author: Schelling Roy
